website_summaries.verdict: Because many drywall screws and hanger nails are magnetic, a simple device like the Master Magnetics stud locator works quite well. Much less expensive than electronic models for basic stud finding.
pros: Super-strong magnet sticks to stud nails
Small enough for a tool belt
cons: Not as versatile as an electronic stud finder
Does not find center of stud, only metal fasteners

customer_reviews.title: Works better than you imagine.
customer_reviews.text: If you ever use an electronic stud finder on a job where it is needed, you know it will not work well. This is a law of the universe. I have had four different stud finders and the last one I threw across the room in a moment of frustration. A friend pulled one of these out of his box and I was instantly shocked and surprised. No battery, nothing to fail. It just slides across the wall a few times and finds a nail and sticks like it was glued. I love it and I will use it from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: A must have in any tool box.
customer_reviews.text: This is so much more reliable and easier to use than my stud finder. I recently completed a storage project and without this I would still be punching peek-a-boo holes in my finished drywall looking for studs. I spent about $45 on my electronic stud finder and it gives off the edge beep for a good 6 inch area. I use it to find the general area and then follow up with this magnet to actually find the stud. Then with a quick peek-a-boo punch to make sure it actually is the stud. The magnet never has let me down.
customer_reviews.author: VTSnoop

customer_reviews.title: Tried it out and it's like a bulldog hunting a bone
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about a magnet finding a nail head but ordered it anyway based on price. Tried it out and it's like a bulldog hunting a bone. When it finds a nail head it latches on & takes a little force to remove. Couldn't get a better stud finder at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST Have!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome to find nail heads in the wall! They make great stocking stuffers too! Get one for all of the men in your life!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Gump

customer_reviews.title: This does not work as well as an electronic one ...
customer_reviews.text: This does not work as well as an electronic one, but it does work and there aren't batteries to worry about so that's a bonus. Compared it side to side with the electronic one and it didn't find as many studs but it did find about 75 percent.
customer_reviews.author: Everydayisagift

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this magnet for a while now and love it. Good quality, strong magnet and it works in most scenarios. Obviously, not for older lath and plaster walls, but almost all stud finders don't so I wasn't expecting a miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Clouseau

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a review by Oscar Jaeger, Lois's husband. I think this product finds studs just as well as, if not better than, the much more expensive Zircon Triscanner Pro, and it is much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lois P.

customer_reviews.title: Great simple gadget
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used it for hanging heavy pictures where I needed to find a stud.
customer_reviews.author: J. Little

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic, but I don't use them as stud finders
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic, but I don't use them as stud finders. I use them to help align graphics on vehicles
customer_reviews.author: Kristin H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t get this to work at all!! I’m not sure if I was doing it correctly but it didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Andreana Hale

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought two different types, this one doesn't stick as well as the other but is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Nore

customer_reviews.title: only a few short minutes for dummies like me.
customer_reviews.text: Most users won't know how to use this. After only a few short minutes I was able to realize it's just a strong magnet and got it to connect to my wall where the stud was without holding it on the wall. Now my tv is mounted and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Guidi

customer_reviews.title: Greatest idea since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Greatest idea since sliced bread. Throw all those battery operated stud finders away and gain some space in your tool box! This is the easiest thing to use. Love it, love it. A+A+A+A+A+
customer_reviews.author: Gunniedog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked immediately, and perfectly. Even used the plumb line feature.
customer_reviews.author: Junior #'s 32:23

customer_reviews.title: It does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Works better than a stud buddy I like it alot
customer_reviews.author: William A Arnold JR.

customer_reviews.title: Stud Finder
customer_reviews.text: Simple inexpensive Stud Finder. It does the job and is small enough to fit in your tool belt without taking up too much space.
customer_reviews.author: Sycamore

customer_reviews.title: Best kind of stud finder there is
customer_reviews.text: Best kind of stud finder there is. Stays in place so I know where to drill without having to use a pencil.
customer_reviews.author: free2shop

customer_reviews.title: ... I think of that works so much easier and better than the unreliable wall sensors
customer_reviews.text: simplest technology you'll think why didn't I think of that works so much easier and better than the unreliable wall sensors.
customer_reviews.author: mcdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great value and it is better than my fancy $49 stud finder.
customer_reviews.author: DigiBuff

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it. has a notch for holding a nail or screw to start it. powerful magnet.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have already used someone elses magnets and really liked them enough to get my own, these are great for a lot of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C Bowe

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any do-it-yourselfer
customer_reviews.text: Best stud finder I have ever used. Far much better than the ones with the lights on them. I have yet to miss a stud by using it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This def does the job, finds and sticks to those studs no problem. I do wish that this product came with either a built in level or the drop string already attached but that is just me. Helped me build a modular closet system!
customer_reviews.author: esidemachine

customer_reviews.title: Great product, right price
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviewers have mentioned, make sure you remove the magnetic shield before you try to use it. Just wave it over the wall and if there's a stud you'll feel plenty of resistance. If you're just looking for a simple stud finder and not some fancy, complicated tool, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget to take the cover off!!
customer_reviews.text: Works well if you take the cover off. It looks like a few of the reviewers here neglected to do that!
customer_reviews.author: star jospe

customer_reviews.title: Every finish carpenter should own one
customer_reviews.text: Simple, effective design with a VERY strong magnet. I keep mine on the metal buckle of my tool belt and it has never came close to falling off. Actually requires quite a bit of force to get it off the buckle. Worth at least twice what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: High End Finish Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: The most accurate finder that I have used.  I haven't miss a stude since using this finder.
customer_reviews.text: Used one of these by my grandson and found out that it is more accurate than the costly ones that I had purchased. Great Item.
customer_reviews.author: phillip pia

customer_reviews.title: didn't work like i thought it would.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have enough magnetic power in it. Wanted to use it on steel studs, not enough power to find them on 5/8" sheetrock. Stud for sure was the best for that. Don't make email anymore what a shame.
customer_reviews.author: andy bortel

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed in the product
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in the product. I purchased it to find nails in salvaged 2x4s and it misses a lot of them when the nails are on the opposite side from the magnet. I purchased a another device for that task.
customer_reviews.author: WB377

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time; does not work properly. Should have invested more money into electronic sensor
customer_reviews.author: M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: stupid thing
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find any stud, didn't work, if could send it back i will I should't give any star to this s***.
customer_reviews.author: Migue Gatica

product_meta.title: Master Magnetics 07512 Magnetic Stud Finder with Shield, Drywall Screw and Nail Locator, Red
product_meta.description: Red, Magnetic Stud Finder With Red Shield, Uses Super Strong Neodymium Magnets To Locate Nails In Studs, Can Be Used As A Nail Starter & For A Plumb Line, Clamshell Package With Barcode.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
